contents:
Kansas City Java User Group Get involved We encourage the Kansas City JUG community to get involved! There are several outlets which community members can use to interact with the rest of the community. Check us out below! We have a passion for all things Java™ Whether you are a dedicated professional or a coding hobbyist, novice developer or seasoned engineer, programming student or lifelong learner, the Kansas City JUG is dedicated to bringing content to the community about all things on the JVM.
If you’re curious about Kotlin, juiced about Jakarta EE, stoked about Spring, or anything in between, our meetups span a variety of topics related to Java™ and other JVM-based technologies.
We feature speakers from the local community as well as internationally renowned speakers, authors, and industry leaders.
In addition to the informative topics, Kansas City JUG meetups give our members the opportunity to network with other developers and our great sponsors! Our other platforms facilitate interaction among our members. Feel free to dive in and share a topic, ask a question, find employment opportunities, or just socialize!
Meetups Kansas City JUG hosts meetups on a monthly basis. Our typical meetups are on the 3rd Wendesday of the month. Occasionally, we host meetups on different days to accomodate speaker travel dates or avoid collision with other events (such as US holidays). To view and RSVP for upcoming events, please see our Meetup page.
Upcoming Open Up your JVM with Open Source Tooling When building and deploying Java applications, gaining insight into their performance characteristics is crucial. This talk will share methods and tools to help you gain a deeper understanding of what's happening in your JVM. You'll learn about improvements in how you can utilize these available tools in your development and evaluate performance issues (CPU, memory, and network) with your Java production workloads. About the Speaker: Carl is a software architect at Oracle. Most of his career has been focused on evolving and scaling the service infrastructure for their core electronic medical record platform called Millennium. He is now working with on their next-generation EHR within Oracle Health. He is passionate about growing a positive engineering culture, optimizing how software teams operate, and working on interesting problems in healthcare. In his spare time, he enjoys blogging about engineering related topics and sharing his poorly made illustrations at https://che55er.io.
Agenda: 5:30-6:15 pm Meet, greet & eat! 6:15-6:20 pm Java News 6:20pm Main presentation
After presentation - social hour: Austins Bar & Grill | South Olathe 2103 E 151st St #2969, Olathe, KS 66062
Learn more Feedback Since we’re always looking for feedback, take a few minutes and let us know what you think!
Can the schedule better accomodate you? What things will bring you out to KC JUG? Should we host workshops? We welcome all other feedback as well. Let us know what’s on your mind!
Sponsoring We rely on sponsorship efforts for bringing speakers to Kansas City and assistance in facilitating a welcoming atmosphere atmosphere for our members. In exchange for sponsorship, our sponsors have the opportunity to join in the networking and social interaction with the members in attendance, as well as receive recognition for their sponsorship.
title: KCJUG
